summary: Star Wars Rebels Moments ✰ 2x22 Twilight of the Apprentice Part 2 Soon after the Eighth Brother's death, Kanan demands to know...
caption:
Star Wars Rebels Moments ✰ 2x22 Twilight of the Apprentice Part 2

Soon after the Eighth Brother’s death, Kanan demands to know where Ezra is. Maul claims Ezra as his apprentice, surprising Ahsoka and Kanan. Maul then uses this opportunity to strike Kanan with his lightsaber, blinding him.

summary:
Anakin: Come on, over the side of the bridge! It’s the quickest way away from the explosions! 
Rex: Yeah, well, technically over...
body:
Anakin: Come on, over the side of the bridge! It’s the quickest way away from the explosions!

Rex: Yeah, well, technically over the side of the building is the quiskest way to the sidewalk but you don’t see me- *gets pushed off and screams*

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

summary: Mãe fotografa suas crianças vestidas de famosos personagens de filmes
title: Mãe fotografa suas crianças vestidas de famosos personagens de filmes
body:
Mãe fotografa suas crianças vestidas de famosos personagens de filmes

A fotógrafa amadora polonesa Anna Rozwadowska é mãe de dois filhos e resolveu registrar a infância deles de uma forma diferente. Ela fotografou as crianças vestidas de famosos personagens de filmes.

Com trajes feitos por ela mesma, as crianças interpretam personagens como Harry Potter, a Rey de Star Wars e usam outras belas roupas confeccionadas para as fotos da mãe.

O trabalho final você…

View On WordPress

External image

A fotógrafa amadora polonesa Anna Rozwadowska é mãe de dois filhos e resolveu registrar a infância deles de uma forma diferente. Ela fotografou as crianças vestidas de famosos personagens de filmes.

Com trajes feitos por ela mesma, as crianças interpretam personagens como Harry Potter, a Rey de Star Wars e usam outras belas roupas confeccionadas para as fotos da mãe.

O trabalho final você…

tags: I kinda feel like the general republic citizenship could work like European Union
you may not be citizen of certain country
but should be treated like that if you belong to EU

can free travel through the countries
summary: I really hope I’m not pestering you or anything, I really love your metas! So here’s another thing I never really thought about...
question: I really hope I’m not pestering you or anything, I really love your metas! So here’s another thing I never really thought about before: is a /general/ republic citizenship a thing? if common sense wins in gffa for once and clones are given citizenship would it be a mandatory planetary citizenship? Most sensible option would be Coruscant ofc, but just imagine if they end up being registered on Kamino.
answer:
Thank you. You don’t pester me at all, don’t worry! I’m glad for all your questions and shared thoughts :)

Well, clones being registered on Kamino makes sense, since it’s place of their birth, albeit there is question would Kamino still be part of Republic when that happened? Did Kamino join Republic for good or was that temporary thing,for the duration of the war, since defending Kamino was mutual benefit for both sides?

Also, I think the same like in our world, in galaxy far away people may also apply for a second citizenship, so even in scenerio all clones are registered on Kamino as Republic citizens, that option should be available to them. Whether other planets accept them or not is another matter. What is the biggest problem, I think.

I can see Anakin trying to get as much troopers as he can to Naboo - and being war hero & husband of ex-queen most likely could help to do it - but how many planets would really like to have clone troopers as their citizens? Mandalore already cut ties with Jango Fett and I’m not sure if pacifist New Mandalorians would want Jango’s clones on their land… especially if as soldiers “bred for war” could become a potential target for Death Watch recruitment (you know, Jango Fett the greatest Mandalorian Warrior, why not embrace your true heritage?)

During war, having them is good, so “normal citizens” don’t need fight, but in the time of peace? Clones as free people would need have access to education, need new jobs, place to live, food, clothes and since they don’t have any money, the government(s) would probably have to subsidize them, at least until they become truly independent. And let’s not forget the possibility of exploiting clones as a cheap labor force by greedy employers - something that happened already in TCW, with the clone commando/Gregor(?) with amnesia, I belive? Frankly, I wouldn’t be surprised if clones were seen as “immigrants who steal jobs from normal people” by native citizens at some point too.

Due to such problems, there is also a chance the Republic may not want to registered all clones in one place - it would be unfair to demand from one planetary government to take care of millions (if not more) people who until that moment were bred only to war. Like I said, clones would need a lot help to become  financially independent, but many of them would also need medical care (injured &  mutilated troopers) and psychological help in helping deal with war trauma and adjusting to new life.

Giving clones a Republic citizenship is just first step, there would be still a lot work to help them adjust into new life. Sadly, being citizenship does not always means having right to vote. If other people will not care for the equality for clones, they would be always vulnerable to abuse.
